metadata.title: CVE-2014-0230 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.44, 7.x before 7.0.55, and 8.x before 8.0.9does not properly handle cases where an HTTP response occurs beforefinishing the reading of an entire request body, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (thread consumption) via a series ofaborted upload attempts.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0230` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3').
